data.text: We have also cancelled a number of flights on January 14-17, 2022 as we continue to manage our manpower levels. Affected passengers have been informed through the contact details provided in their booking.

We encourage passengers traveling for non-essential purposes to take any of our flexible options (rebook, travel fund, refund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WonRbR).
As such, we are extending flexible options for all our passengers with domestic and international flights until January 23, 2022.

data.text:
said Candice Iyog, Cebu Pacific Vice President for Marketing and Customer Experience. 

We have also cancelled a number of flights on January 12, 2022 as we continue to manage our manpower levels.

“We are working non-stop to minimize impact on crew and passengers. The health and safety of everyJuan remain our top priority and we continue to humbly ask for your patience as we manage this situation to the best of our capabilities,”

We encourage passengers traveling for non-essential purposes to take any of our flexible options (rebook, travel fund, refund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WoEUdR).

Due to this, flight delays and on-the-spot cancellations remain a possibility given the uncertainty of the situation.  

As such, we are extending flexible options for all our passengers with domestic and international flights until January 23, 2022.

data.text: We apologize for the inconvenience this has brought about to our passengers and thank every Juan for their kind understanding, as the whole world navigates through this pandemic,” said Candice Iyog, Cebu Pacific Vice President for Marketing and Customer Experience.
“We are doing our best to address the needs of both our employees and passengers as we manage this situation and remain committed to prioritizing health and safety above all else.

We are encouraging passengers traveling for non-essential purposes from January 8 to 15, to avail any of CEB’s flexible options (rebook, travel fund, refund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WoEUdR)
Flight delays and on-the-spot cancellations remain a possibility given the uncertainty of the situation. As such.

data.text: We are managing the impact of COVID-19 on our workforce after receiving an unprecedented level of employees who are either sick or under home quarantine. Despite best efforts, the current situation has resulted in necessary reductions in scheduled flights.

Cebu Pacific Travel Advisory #5  
Flexible Options for Domestic and International Flights until January 15, 2022  
As of 4:00PM, January 8, 2022 https://t.co/4aGcIaQEU2

Every Juan is doing their best to make sure you have safe skies. 

Thank you for being patient and kind to those who showed up to take you to your destination✈️🤗 https://t.co/HV2GtZN5Gt

For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the Chatbot on the Cebu Pacific website.  

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

data.text: Before going to the airport, passengers are advised to check the travel requirements, safety protocols, and frequently asked questions (FAQs) on the CEB website: https://t.co/lBwTdCK3yJ
Passengers are advised to update their contact details via https://t.co/NZi62XwPtR to receive email notifications on flight reminders and updates.

CEB has also started its booster program to ensure the continued safety of its employees and passengers.  

The safety of our employees and passengers remains to be our priority.
CEB operates with 100% fully vaccinated active flying crew. Our pilots and cabin crew undergo regular antigen testing (Test Before Duty) before they are assigned to operate flights.

Passengers who wish to voluntarily postpone their travel plans may conveniently cancel up to two (2) hours before their scheduled time of departure and select their preferred option (rebook or travel fund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website.
Furthermore, Cebu Pacific is offering flexible options for all domestic flights until January 31, 2022.
They may opt to avail themselves of other available options (rebook, travel fund, refund) through our Manage Boking portal (https://t.co/GAB2WonRbR) until 30 days from date of departure.
Passengers affected by the cancellations have been informed through the contact details provided in their booking.

Cebu Pacific also continues to review its manpower levels with employees currently on quarantine. But we assure everyJuan that CEB is working non-stop to minimize impact on customers and crew, while practicing health protocols.

The full list of flights may be viewed here: https://t.co/JUbhlOv5Et 

As the situation remains fluid, additional flight cancellations may take place in the coming days, and so we appeal for your patience and understanding.

Following the move of the Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines (CAAP) to limit the number of arrivals at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport, CEB has cancelled a number of flights until January 10, 2022.
Cebu Pacific is working closely with its regulators and stakeholders as the aviation industry manages the impact of COVID-19 on its workforce.

Cebu Pacific Travel Advisory #4  
Flight Cancellations until January 10, 2022  
As of 4:30PM, January 7, 2022 https://t.co/k91EJXr9Qu

The safety of our employees and passengers remains to be our priority. 

Passengers are advised to update their contact details via https://t.co/NZi62XwPtR to receive email notifications on flight reminders and updates.
CEB has also started its booster program to ensure the continued safety of its employees and passengers.
CEB operates with 100% fully vaccinated active flying crew. Our pilots and cabin crew undergo regular antigen testing (Test Before Duty) before they are assigned to operate flights.

Passengers who wish to voluntarily postpone their travel plans may conveniently cancel up to two (2) hours before their scheduled time of departure and select their preferred option (rebook or travel fund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website.
Furthermore, Cebu Pacific is offering flexible options for all domestic flights until January 31, 2022.
They may opt to avail themselves of other available options (rebook, travel fund, refund) through our Manage Boking portal (https://t.co/GAB2WonRbR) until 30 days from date of departure.
Passengers affected by the cancellations have been informed through the contact details provided in their booking.
But we assure everyJuan that CEB is working non-stop to minimize impact on customers and crew, while practicing health protocols.

As the situation remains fluid, additional flight cancellations may take place in the coming days, and so we appeal for your patience and understanding. 

Cebu Pacific also continues to review its manpower levels with employees currently on quarantine.
The full list of flights may be viewed here: https://t.co/JUbhlOv5Et

Following the move of the Civil Aviation Authority of the Philippines (CAAP) to limit the number of arrivals at the Ninoy Aquino International Airport, CEB has cancelled a number of flights until January 10, 2022.

data.text: Before going to the airport, passengers are advised to check the travel requirements, safety protocols, and frequently asked questions (FAQs) on the CEB website: https://t.co/lBwTdD16AJ
Passengers are advised to update their contact details via https://t.co/NZi62XeGfJ to receive email notifications on flight reminders and updates.

CEB has also started its booster program to ensure the continued safety of its employees and passengers.

The safety of our employees and passengers remains to be our priority.
CEB operates with 100% fully vaccinated active flying crew. Our pilots and cabin crew undergo regular antigen testing (Test Before Duty) before they are assigned to operate flights.

For everyJuan's safety and to continuously drive contactless flights, the CEB Terminal 3 Ticket Office is closed until further notice. We encourage our passengers to safely manage all their bookings online.

Passengers who wish to voluntarily postpone their travel plans may conveniently cancel up to two (2) hours before their scheduled time of departure and select their preferred option (rebook or travel fund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website.
Furthermore, Cebu Pacific is offering flexible options for all domestic flights until January 31, 2022.
They may also opt to avail themselves of other available options (rebook, travel fund, refund) through our Manage Booking portal (https://t.co/GAB2WoEUdR) until 30 days from date of departure.

The full list of cancelled flights may be viewed here: https://t.co/JUbhlOM8Gt 

Passengers affected by the cancellations have been informed of their new flight schedules through the contact details provided in their booking.

To prevent last-minute cancellations due to unavailability of crew and ground personnel, CEB is preemptively cancelling a number of domestic flights from January 7 to 10, 2022, and transferring passengers on other available CEB flights on the same day.
Cebu Pacific is reviewing its network schedule and closely monitoring manpower levels with employees currently on quarantine.

Cebu Pacific Travel Advisory #3  

Flight Cancellations and Flexible Options for All Domestic Flights until January 31, 2022  

As of 12:30PM, January 6, 2022 https://t.co/yvRSgDAevj

For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the Chatbot on the Cebu Pacific website.

Thank you for your patience and understanding.

data.text: Our fleet of Airbus jets are equipped with hospital-grade High Efficiency Particulate Arrestor (HEPA) filters that are capable of filtering microscopic bacteria and virus clusters, including the COVID-19 with 99.99% efficiency.
This process also ensures that all surfaces (such as passenger seats, overhead bins and cargo compartments) are covered and sanitized.

All CEB aircraft undergo extensive daily disinfection, which includes the misting of the cabin using a disinfectant approved for Airbus jets that is effective in eradicating viruses including the Novel Coronavirus.
CEB operates with 100% fully vaccinated active flying crew. Our pilots and cabin crew undergo regular antigen testing (Test Before Duty) before they are assigned to operate flights.
CEB has also started its booster program to ensure the continued safety of its employees and passengers.

Passengers may also opt to avail themselves of their preferred option (rebook, travel fund, refund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WoEUdR) until 30 days from date of departure.
Affected passengers who have been transferred to other flights available on the same day have been informed via contact details provided in their booking.

Given the developing situation, CEB is now reviewing its network and manpower levels. As a preemptive measure, the airline is consolidating a number of its flights and has cancelled some flights from January 4-10, 2022. The full list may be viewed here: https://t.co/mM1lFLB2ET

Cebu Pacific continues to monitor the situation in its domestic stations after the Philippines’ Inter-Agency Task Force for the Management of Emerging Infectious Diseases (IATF-EID) raised Metro Manila to Alert Level 3 Status until January 15, 2022.

A big salute to our Moment Maker volunteers and everyJuan who are working tirelessly to send aid to those affected by Super Typhoon #OdettePH. 

If you would like to extend support and send over aid via Cebu Pacific Cargo, here's a quick guide: https://t.co/aD1dLBRaxF https://t.co/C0LaPKWP8U

For everyJuan who wants to donate and send aid, here's a quick guide on what Cebu Pacific Cargo can and cannot fly to those who were affected by Super Typhoon #OdettePH.

For more information on cargo relief guidelines, read here: https://t.co/uohyDuoaQV https://t.co/i5rg9z8GOs
For other questions or concerns, passengers may send a message via Charlie the chatbot on the Cebu Pacific website.

Passengers are advised to refer to the full list of affected flights here: https://t.co/f0i7ZOjlKY  

The safety of our passengers and crew in affected areas remains our topmost priority. Thank you for your patience and understanding.
They may conveniently cancel up to two (2) hours before their scheduled time of departure and select their preferred option through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website.

Other domestic flights in and out of Cebu will still operate as scheduled, however CEB is also offering flexible options (rebook or travel fund) to those who wish to voluntarily postpone their trips until December 31, 2021.

Affected passengers are being informed via contact details provided in the booking. They may select their preferred option (rebook, travel fund, or refund) through the Manage Booking portal on the Cebu Pacific website (https://t.co/GAB2WoEUdR) until 30 days from date of departure

The Mactan Cebu International Airport has resumed operations but still caters to limited domestic flights. Given the operational limitations in the aftermath of Super Typhoon Odette (Rai), Cebu Pacific has canceled the following flights from December 24 to 31, 2021.

#CEBAdvisory Cebu Pacific Advisory #18 

Additional Flight Cancellations in the Aftermath of Super Typhoon Odette 

As of 7:00PM, December 22, 2021 https://t.co/elb65pTzBI
